sentences.sContent: I do most of my studying in the evening.
I’m usually out on Friday evenings.
sentences.sCn: 周五晚上我通常都不在家。

sentences.sContent: What are you doing tomorrow evening?
sentences.sCn: 明天晚上你打算做什么？

sentences.sContent: It was early evening by the time we got home.
sentences.sCn: 我们到家时已经是傍晚了。

sentences.sContent: We had just finished our evening meal when the doorbell rang.
sentences.sCn: 我们刚吃完晚饭门铃就响了。

sentences.sContent: a broadcast on the evening news
...What does the woman say about her evening class...
...she would take an evening to walk me through my errors...
...There's nothing mysterious about cooking the evening meal...
...which grew out of volunteer evening seminars for students...
...Can I ask you about your evening class...
...Do you want a day or evening course...
...it would have to be an evening course since I work during the day...
...Why does the man choose to take an evening course...
...21: What do we learn about the schedule of the evening course...
...By six o'clock that evening I had signed contracts with seven companies to rent plants from me and pay me a fee to maintain them...

synos.tran: 晚上；傍晚；（联欢性的）晚会；后期

words.tran: [数] 偶数的；平坦的；相等的
前夕；傍晚；重大事件关头
变平；变得可比较；成为相等

trans.tranOther: the early part of the night between the end of the day and the time you go to bed
